other_tests.procedure_name: Excisional biopsy of cervical lymph node
other_tests.findings: Cytometric investigation showed B lymphocytes with non-malignant features and a reduced CD4 to CD8 lymphocyte ratio. Histologic exam revealed histiocytic necrotizing lymphadenitis. Microscopic and cultural exams were negative.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Five years earlier, a lymph node biopsy showed lymphoid follicular hyperplasia with paracortical expansion and large areas containing immunoblasts, histiocytes, and apoptotic cells, while atypical cells were absent.
